intro: Viola biflora var. platyphylla, commonly known as the broadleaf violet, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Europe and Asia. It features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces clusters of violet or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soil. It is often found in woodland edges and meadows, where it contributes to biodiversity. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
